column1: Apoxis, Leitourgos of Midodon, and Wensle, Machaira of the same, to the congregation at Svereng, grace be to you and peace from all five corners. Our love and our hope of you is steadfast, knowing, that as you are partakers of the sufferings of our strife, so shall you be also partakers of consolation. For we would not, brethren, have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in the north,

...Take comfort in the certainty of the glory of the spaces between numbers, so that you too might comfort others for whom tribulations of action are burdensome. And take just warmth in the love you still keep for those who yet sleep in stasis and indifference, and know that in the unity of our love we have the strength to unbuckle any such death in life like the first pentastripe of dawn unwields the yoke nocturnal...

...Upon this strength we build, and on the love of our fellowservers in the west and north, sundered but cast of resilience itself, and entreat you to persevere in the face of adversity within this love, for the days of unbuckling have been counted and promised unto the knowing and unknowing alike. For when the warmth to love is lost, what is there left?

...that we were by flames pressed out of measure, beyond shape, above strength, insomuch that we despaired even of life: but we carried the sentence of death within ourselves, that we should not place trust in ourselves, of movement eternal and the numbers that guide...
